import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as py
import plotly.graph_objects as go
%matplotlib inline
source.014a1719:
fig=py.pie(campus,names=campus['10th grade board'],values=campus['10th grade percent'],hole=0.8,color_discrete_sequence=['#FFFF00','#556B2F'])
fig.update_traces(textposition='outside',textinfo='label+percent')
fig.update_layout(annotations=[dict(text='10th grade percent',showarrow=False)])
source.6fd135d2: py.density_heatmap(campus,x=campus['Higher secondary specialization'],y=campus['Higher secondary board'],z=campus['Higher secondary percent'],color_continuous_scale='ice')
source.b448e6cc:
track=go.Bar(x=campus['gender'],
            y=campus['10th grade percent'],
            name='10th percent',
             marker_color='#7FFF00'
        )
track1=go.Bar(x=campus['gender'],
            y=campus['Higher secondary percent'],
            name='HSC percent',
             marker_color='#00BFFF'
        )
track2=go.Bar(x=campus['gender'],
            y=campus['degree_percent'],
            name='Degree percent',
             marker_color='#FFFF00'
        )
track3=go.Bar(x=campus['gender'],
            y=campus['mba_percent'],
            name='MBA_percent',
             marker_color='#FF1493'
        )
data=[track,track1,track2,track3]
layout=go.Layout(xaxis=dict(title='gender'),yaxis=dict(title='Percent'))
fig=go.Figure(data=data,layout=layout)
fig.show()
source.9e6d7266: Commerce and Management degree students have more work experience and more students don't have experience
source.7380a938: There are 214 rows in the dataset
source.9facd688: The percentage for the 10th grade is higher for the central board than the others
source.d02afcaf: Students who got placed seems to have more percentage than not placed.
